question: Instructions (computer programs) that when executed provide desired function and performance
Software system delivered to a customer
Produced by a development organization and sold on the open market to any customer who is able to buy such product
commissioned by a particular customer and developed by some contractor to suit the specific needs of the customer
An engineering discipline that is concerned with all aspects of software production such that high-quality software is produced in a cost-effective manner
Software failures receive a lot more publicity than software engineering success stories
In the Waterfall Model, customers need interim releases
There are two types of Evolutionary Development: Exploratory and Throw-away prototyping
In Throw-away prototyping, development starts with parts of the system that are understood.
In Formal Development, transformations are correctness-preserving so it is straightforward to show that the program conforms to its specification
Formal development does not require specialised skills and training
Reuse-oriented development are Used by developers who know of designs or codes which are similar to that required
Incremental model was initially suggested by Mills 1980
Incremental model is Most appropriate for systems with strict requirements in terms of reliability and risk management
Package-Based Development Model is Based on the use of commercial-off-the-shelf packages (COTS)
Process phases are interleaved
Process phases are distinct and separate
System is assembled from existing components
A mathematical system model is formally transformed to an implementation
Describes a set of clear stages in the development process, and a specific set of deliverables (documents, code, etc) which must be produced during each stage
A variation of the repository model; A shared repository of problems, partial solutions, suggestions and contributed information.
Consists of a central data store and a set of independent components that access the data store
Accomplished by applying a local transformation to the input streams and computing incrementally so output begins before input is consumed
Organizes a system into layers, each of which provide a set of services
Widely used for machine control applications and are typically modeled via finite state machines
